name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $url
desc: Returns: An absolute URI that is used to identify this code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this code system is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the code system. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions). This is used in [Coding]{datatypes.html#Coding}.system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: An absolute URI that is used to identify this code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this code system is (or will be) published.

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

name: $::version
desc: Returns: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the code system author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. This is used in [Coding]{datatypes.html#Coding}.version.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the code system author and is not expected to be globally unique. For exampl

name: $::name
desc: Returns: A natural language name identifying the code system. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A natural language name identifying the code system. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

name: $title
desc: Returns: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the code system.

name: $status
desc: Returns: The status of this code system. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The status of this code system. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

name: $experimental
desc: Returns: A boolean value to indicate that this code system is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A boolean value to indicate that this code system is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

name: $date
desc: Returns: The date  (and optionally time) when the code system was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the code system changes.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date  (and optionally time) when the code system was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the code system

name: $publisher
desc: Returns: The name of the individual or organization that published the code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The name of the individual or organization that published the code system.

name: $contact
desc: Returns: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

name: $addcontact
desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

name: $description
desc: Returns: A free text natural language description of the code system from a consumer's perspective.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A free text natural language description of the code system from a consumer's perspective.

name: $useContext
desc: Returns: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate code system instances.

name: $adduseContext
desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate code system instances.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate code system instances.

name: $jurisdiction
desc: Returns: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.

name: $addjurisdiction
desc: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.

name: $purpose
desc: Returns: Explaination of why this code system is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Explaination of why this code system is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

name: $copyright
desc: Returns: A copyright statement relating to the code system and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A copyright statement relating to the code system and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the code system.

name: $caseSensitive
desc: Returns: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.

name: $valueSet
desc: Returns: Canonical URL of value set that contains the entire code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Canonical URL of value set that contains the entire code system.

name: $hierarchyMeaning
desc: Returns: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts.

name: $compositional
desc: Returns: True If code system defines a post-composition grammar.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: True If code system defines a post-composition grammar.

name: $versionNeeded
desc: Returns: This flag is used to signify that the code system has not (or does not) maintain the definitions, and a version must be specified when referencing this code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: This flag is used to signify that the code system has not (or does not) maintain the definitions, and a version must be specified when referencing this code system.

name: $content
desc: Returns: How much of the content of the code system - the concepts and codes it defines - are represented in this resource.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: How much of the content of the code system - the concepts and codes it defines - are represented in this resource.

name: $count
desc: Returns: The total number of concepts defined by the code system. Where the code system has a compositional grammar, the count refers to the number of base (primitive) concepts.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The total number of concepts defined by the code system. Where the code system has a compositional grammar, the count refers to the number of base (primitive) concepts.

name: $filter
desc: Returns: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.

name: $addfilter
desc: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.

name: $property
desc: Returns: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

name: $addproperty
desc: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

name: $concept
desc: Returns: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meaning of the hierarchical relationships are.

name: $addconcept
desc: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meaning of the hierarchical relationships are.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meaning of the hierarchical relationships are.
